entry.title: Combined summary - Payment Re-routing
entry.summary: The Lightning Network is a system that allows for fast and inexpensive Bitcoin transactions. However, concerns have arisen about potential misbehavior by nodes in the network, both intentional and non-malicious. To address this, there have been suggestions of implementing a directory authority system similar to Tor's nine "directory authorities," which would help ensure the availability and reliability of nodes.In addition to concerns about misbehavior, there are also issues related to routing failures. Solutions are needed to get money back to the sender and pay intermediaries who lock up their money for a certain period of time. Delaying payment is not seen as a desirable option since it goes against the Lightning network's speedy nature.The conversation around these challenges has touched on various potential solutions. For example, some have suggested conditional refunds or a rating system to incentivize honest behavior. There has also been discussion about methods for detecting and tracking misbehavior, including active scanning versus passive scanning. The incentives and potential issues surrounding payment failures and rerouting have also been explored.While no definitive solutions have been proposed, the conversation has shed light on the difficulties involved in building a secure and robust payment network. By exploring different ideas and possibilities, the Lightning Network community is working towards creating a more reliable and trustworthy system.
